content: Hello, my pr #13200 has been awaiting review since three weeks, will it get reviewed? Or did I made something wrong?
It all looks fine. It's just right now #queue has got over 200 PRs waiting to be reviewed.
And our resident combinatorist has (had?) exams for the last few weeks
Is it normal to have to wait so long?
Take a look at the queue and look at how long the PRs there have been waiting. This will give you a feeling for what is normal.
Ok, yes, I see that there much older ones
Last year I proved several things about graph coloring, and I'm trying to contribute them to mathlib, but it's seems that it will take me ages

There is a chronic shortage of reviewer time, so if you see any PRs on the queue that pique your interest, feel free to help out by leaving reviews! And if you're lucky, a grateful author might review your PR in turn...
Is there an explanation of how to do that processes somewhere? I have seen it in other pull request, but I'm a little afraid of doing it wrong
There is! See this page, and of course feel free to ask questions on Zulip.
Iván Renison has marked this topic as resolved.

Ruben Van de Velde said:

And our resident combinatorist has (had?) exams for the last few weeks

Yes, I am done with exams now! Please send combinatorics PRs my way (or Bhavik's or Kyle's, the people in the leanprover-community/mathlib-co team) :smile:
Note that I will again be mostly unavailable between the 20th of June and 5th of July
